classes.name: AttachmentBuilder
classes.description: Builder for attachment metadata (filename, description, spoiler). Actual file data is passed separately when sending.

params.name: id
params.description: Index of the attachment (0-based). Must match the FormData part order.

methods.name: setDescription
methods.description: Set the attachment description (alt text).

methods.name: setName
methods.description: Set the displayed filename.

methods.name: setSpoiler
methods.description: Mark the attachment as a spoiler (blurred until clicked).

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Convert to API format for MessagePayload.

classes.name: Channel
classes.description: Base class for all channel types.

params.name: data
params.description: API channel from GET /channels/{id} or GET /guilds/{id}/channels

methods.name: createDM
methods.description: Create a DM channel from API data (type DM or GroupDM).

methods.name: from

params.name: client
params.description: The client instance

params.name: data
params.description: Channel data from the API

methods.description: Create the appropriate channel subclass from API data.

methods.name: fromOrCreate
methods.description:
Create a channel from API data, including DM and GroupDM.
Used by ChannelManager.fetch() for GET /channels/{id}.

methods.name: isDM
methods.description: Whether this channel is a DM or Group DM.

methods.name: isSendable
methods.description: Whether this channel has a send method (TextChannel, DMChannel).

methods.name: isVoice
methods.description: Whether this channel is voice-based (VoiceChannel).

classes.name: ChannelManager
classes.description:
Manages channels with fetch and send.
Extends Collection so you can use .get(), .set(), .filter(), etc.

methods.name: fetch

params.name: channelId
params.description: Snowflake of the channel

methods.description: Fetch a channel by ID from the API (or return from cache if present).
examples:
const channel = await client.channels.fetch(channelId);
if (channel?.isSendable()) await channel.send('Hello!');

methods.name: fetchMessage

params.name: channelId
params.description: Snowflake of the channel

params.name: messageId
params.description: Snowflake of the message

methods.description: Fetch a message by ID from the API.
examples:
const channel = await client.channels.fetch(channelId);
const message = await channel?.messages?.fetch(messageId);

methods.name: send

params.name: channelId
params.description: Snowflake of the channel (text channel or DM)

params.name: payload
params.description: Text content or object with content and/or embeds

methods.description:
Send a message to a channel by ID. Works even when the channel is not cached.
Skips the fetch when you only need to send.
examples:
await client.channels.send(logChannelId, 'User joined!');
await client.channels.send(channelId, { embeds: [embed.toJSON()] });

classes.name: Client
classes.description: Main Fluxer bot client. Connects to the gateway, emits events, and provides REST access.

params.name: options
params.description: Token, REST config, WebSocket, presence, etc.

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Disconnect from the gateway and clear cached data.

methods.name: fetchMessage

params.name: channelId
params.description: Snowflake of the channel

params.name: messageId
params.description: Snowflake of the message

methods.description: Fetch a message by channel and message ID. Use when you have IDs (e.g. from a DB).
examples:
const channel = await client.channels.fetch(channelId);
const message = await channel?.messages?.fetch(messageId);

methods.name: getOrCreateUser
methods.description:
Get or create a User from API data. Caches in client.users.
Updates existing user's username, avatar, etc. when fresh data is provided.

methods.name: isReady
methods.description: Returns true if the client has received Ready and `user` is set.

methods.name: login

params.name: token
params.description: Bot token (e.g. from FLUXER_BOT_TOKEN)

methods.description: Connect to the Fluxer gateway and authenticate.

methods.name: resolveEmoji

params.name: emoji
params.type: string | { name: string; id?: string; animated?: boolean; }
params.description: Emoji string or object

params.name: guildId
params.description: Guild ID for resolving custom emoji by name (required when id is missing)

methods.description:
Resolve an emoji argument to the API format (unicode or "name:id").
Supports: <:name:id>, :name:, name:id, { name, id }, unicode.
When id is missing (e.g. :name:), fetches guild emojis if guildId provided.

methods.name: sendToChannel
methods.description:
Send a message to any channel by ID. Shorthand for client.channels.send().
Works even when the channel is not cached.

methods.name: sendToGateway

params.name: shardId
params.description: Shard ID (use 0 for single-shard)

params.name: payload
params.description: Gateway payload to send

methods.description: Send a payload to the gateway (e.g. Voice State Update).

classes.name: Collection
classes.description:
Extended Map with utility methods for key-value collections.
Similar to discord.js Collection.

methods.name: clone
methods.description: Creates an identical shallow copy of this collection.

methods.name: concat
methods.description: Combines this collection with others into a new collection.

methods.name: every
methods.description: Tests whether all elements pass the test implemented by the provided function.

methods.name: filter
methods.description: Creates a new collection with all elements that pass the test implemented by the provided function.

methods.name: find
methods.description: Searches for a single item where the given function returns a truthy value.

methods.name: findKey
methods.description: Returns the key of the first item where the given function returns a truthy value.

methods.name: first
methods.description: Obtains the first value(s) in this collection.

methods.name: last
methods.description: Obtains the last value(s) in this collection.

methods.name: map
methods.description: Creates a new array with the results of calling the provided function on every element.

methods.name: partition
methods.description: Partitions the collection into two collections: one that passes the predicate and one that fails.

methods.name: random
methods.description: Returns a random value from this collection.

methods.name: reduce

params.name: fn
params.type: (accumulator: T, value: V, key: K) => T

methods.description: Applies a function against an accumulator and each element to reduce the collection to a single value.

methods.name: some
methods.description: Tests whether at least one element passes the test implemented by the provided function.

methods.name: sort

params.name: compareFn
params.type: (a: V, b: V, aKey: K, bKey: K) => number

methods.description: Sorts the collection in place and returns it.

methods.name: tap
methods.description: Invokes the given function and returns this collection (for chaining).

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Returns an array of the values in this collection.

methods.name: toString
methods.description: Returns a string representation of the collection (array of values).

classes.name: DMChannel
classes.description: DM channel (direct message between bot and a user).

methods.name: fetchMessage

params.name: messageId
params.description: Snowflake of the message

methods.description: Fetch a message by ID from this DM channel.

methods.name: fetchPinnedMessages
methods.description: Fetch pinned messages in this DM channel.

methods.name: send

params.name: options
params.description: Text content or object with `content` and/or `embeds`

methods.description: Send a message to this DM channel.

classes.name: EmbedBuilder
classes.description: Builder for creating rich embeds. Use `toJSON()` when passing to `reply`, `send`, or `edit`.

methods.name: addFields
methods.description: Add one or more fields. Max 25 fields.

methods.name: from
methods.description: Create an EmbedBuilder from an existing API embed.

methods.name: setAuthor
methods.description: Set the embed author (name, optional icon URL and link).

methods.name: setColor
methods.description: Set the embed color. Number (hex), hex string, or `[r,g,b]` array.

methods.name: setDescription
methods.description: Set the embed description. Max 4096 characters.

methods.name: setFooter
methods.description: Set the embed footer (text, optional icon URL).

methods.name: setImage
methods.description: Set the embed image URL.

methods.name: setThumbnail
methods.description: Set the embed thumbnail URL.

methods.name: setTimestamp
methods.description: Set the embed timestamp. Omit for current time.

methods.name: setTitle
methods.description: Set the embed title. Max 256 characters.

methods.name: setURL
methods.description: Set the embed URL (title becomes a link).

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Convert to API embed format for `reply`, `send`, or `edit`.

properties.name: errors
properties.type: { path: string; message: string; code?: string; }[] | undefined

classes.name: Guild
classes.description: Represents a Fluxer guild (server).

params.name: data
params.description: API guild from GET /guilds/{id} or gateway GUILD_CREATE

methods.name: addRoleToMember

params.name: userId
params.description: The user ID of the member

params.name: roleId
params.description:
The role ID to add (or use guild.resolveRoleId for mention/name resolution)
Requires Manage Roles permission.

methods.description: Add a role to a member by user ID. Does not require fetching the member first.

methods.name: bannerURL
methods.description: Get the guild banner URL, or null if no banner.

methods.name: fetchAuditLogs

params.name: options
params.type: { limit?: number; before?: string; after?: string; userId?: string; actionType?: number; }
params.description: Optional limit, before, after, user_id, action_type for filtering

methods.description: Fetch guild audit logs. Requires View Audit Log permission.

methods.name: fetchMember

params.name: userId
params.description: The user ID of the member to fetch

methods.description: Fetch a guild member by user ID.

methods.name: fetchWebhooks
methods.description: Fetch all webhooks in this guild. Returned webhooks do not include the token (cannot send).

methods.name: iconURL
methods.description: Get the guild icon URL, or null if no icon.

methods.name: removeRoleFromMember

params.name: userId
params.description: The user ID of the member

params.name: roleId
params.description:
The role ID to remove
Requires Manage Roles permission.

methods.description: Remove a role from a member by user ID. Does not require fetching the member first.

methods.name: resolveRoleId

params.name: arg
params.description: Role mention (@role), role ID, or role name

methods.description:
Resolve a role ID from an argument (role mention, raw ID, or name).
Fetches guild roles if name is provided.

classes.name: GuildBan
classes.description: Represents a ban in a guild.

params.description: API ban from GET /guilds/{id}/bans or gateway GUILD_BAN_ADD

Remove this ban (unban the user).
Requires Ban Members permission.

params.name: options
params.description: Webhook name and optional avatar URL

methods.description: Create a webhook in this channel.

methods.description: Fetch all webhooks in this channel.

classes.name: GuildEmoji
classes.description: Represents a custom emoji in a guild.

Edit this emoji's name.
Requires Manage Emojis and Stickers permission.

classes.name: GuildManager
classes.description:
Manages guilds with fetch.
Extends Collection so you can use .get(), .set(), .filter(), etc.

methods.name: fetch

params.name: guildId
params.description: Snowflake of the guild

methods.description: Fetch a guild by ID from the API (or return from cache if present).
examples:
const guild = await client.guilds.fetch(guildId);
if (guild) console.log(guild.name);

classes.name: GuildMember
classes.description: Represents a member of a guild.

methods.name: addRole

params.name: roleId
params.description:
The role ID to add
Requires Manage Roles permission.

methods.description: Add a role to this member.

methods.name: removeRole

params.name: roleId
params.description:
The role ID to remove
Requires Manage Roles permission.

classes.name: GuildSticker
classes.description: Represents a custom sticker in a guild.

params.description: API sticker from GET /guilds/{id}/stickers or guild sticker events

methods.name: edit

Edit this sticker's name and/or description.
Requires Manage Emojis and Stickers permission.

classes.name: Invite
classes.description: Represents an invite to a guild or channel.

params.name: data
params.description: API invite from GET /invites/{code}, channel/guild invite list, or gateway INVITE_CREATE

methods.name: delete
methods.description:
Delete this invite.
Requires Manage Guild or Create Instant Invite permission.

methods.name: getGuild
methods.description: Resolve the guild from cache if available.

classes.name: LiveKitRtcConnection
classes.description:
Voice connection using LiveKit RTC. Used when Fluxer routes voice to LiveKit.

Supports both audio playback ({@link play}) and video streaming ({@link playVideo}) to voice channels.
Video uses node-webcodecs for decoding (no ffmpeg subprocess). Audio uses prism-media WebM demuxer.

params.name: client
params.description: The Fluxer client instance

params.name: channel
params.description: The voice channel to connect to

params.name: _userId
params.description: The user ID (reserved for future use)

methods.name: connect

params.name: server
params.description: Voice server update data (endpoint, token)

params.name: _state
params.description: Voice state update data (session, channel)

methods.description:
Connect to the LiveKit room using voice server and state from the gateway.
Called internally by VoiceManager; typically not used directly.

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Disconnect from the room and remove all event listeners.

methods.name: disconnect
methods.description: Disconnect from the LiveKit room and stop all playback.

methods.name: isConnected
methods.description: Returns true if the LiveKit room is connected and not destroyed.

methods.name: isSameServer

params.name: endpoint
params.description: Voice server endpoint from the gateway

params.name: token
params.description: Voice server token

methods.description: Returns true if we're already connected to the given server (skip migration).

methods.name: play

params.name: urlOrStream
params.description: Audio source: HTTP(S) URL to a WebM/Opus file, or a Node.js ReadableStream

methods.description: Play audio from a WebM/Opus URL or readable stream. Publishes to the LiveKit room as an audio track.

methods.name: playVideo

params.name: urlOrBuffer
params.description: Video source: HTTP(S) URL to an MP4 file, or raw ArrayBuffer/Uint8Array of MP4 data

params.name: options
params.description: Optional playback options (see {@link VideoPlayOptions})

methods.description:
Play video from an MP4 URL or buffer. Streams decoded frames to the LiveKit room as a video track.
Uses node-webcodecs for decoding (no ffmpeg). Supports H.264 (avc1) and H.265 (hvc1/hev1) codecs.

methods.name: playVideoFFmpeg
methods.description:
FFmpeg-based video playback. Bypasses node-webcodecs to avoid libc++abi crashes on macOS.
Requires ffmpeg and ffprobe in PATH. URL input only.

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stop playback and clear both audio and video tracks.

classes.name: Message
classes.description: Represents a message in a channel.

params.name: data
params.description: API message from POST/PATCH /channels/{id}/messages or gateway MESSAGE_CREATE

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Delete this message.

methods.name: edit

params.name: options
params.description: New content and/or embeds

methods.description: Edit this message. Only the author (or admins) can edit.

methods.name: fetch
methods.description:
Re-fetch this message from the API to get the latest content, embeds, reactions, etc.
Use when you have a stale Message (e.g. from an old event or cache) and need fresh data.
examples:
const updated = await message.fetch();
if (updated) console.log('Latest content:', updated.content);

methods.name: formatEmoji
methods.description:
Format emoji for reaction API: unicode string or "name:id" for custom.
For string resolution (e.g. :name:), use client.resolveEmoji; Message methods resolve automatically when guildId is available.

methods.name: pin
methods.description: Pin this message to the channel. Requires Manage Messages permission.

methods.name: react

params.name: emoji
params.type: string | { name: string; id?: string; animated?: boolean; }
params.description: Unicode emoji, custom `{ name, id }`, `:name:`, `name:id`, or `<:name:id>`

methods.description: Add a reaction to this message (as the bot).

methods.name: removeAllReactions
methods.description:
Remove all reactions from this message.
Requires moderator permissions.

methods.name: removeReaction

params.name: emoji
params.type: string | { name: string; id?: string; animated?: boolean; }
params.description: Unicode emoji, custom `{ name, id }`, `:name:`, `name:id`, or `<:name:id>`

params.name: userId
params.description: If provided, removes that user's reaction (requires moderator permissions)

methods.description: Remove the bot's reaction, or a specific user's reaction if userId is provided.

methods.name: removeReactionEmoji

params.name: emoji
params.type: string | { name: string; id?: string; animated?: boolean; }
params.description: Unicode emoji, custom `{ name, id }`, `:name:`, `name:id`, or `<:name:id>`. Requires moderator permissions.

methods.description: Remove all reactions of a specific emoji from this message.

methods.name: reply

params.name: options
params.description: Text content or object with content and/or embeds

methods.description: Reply to this message.

params.name: emoji
params.type: string | { name: string; id?: string; animated?: boolean; }

methods.name: send

params.name: options
params.description: Text content or object with content and/or embeds

methods.description: Send a message to this channel without replying. Use when you want a standalone message.

methods.name: sendTo

params.name: channelId
params.description: Snowflake of the target channel (e.g. log channel ID)

params.name: options
params.description: Text content or object with content and/or embeds

methods.description: Send a message to a specific channel. Use for logging, forwarding, or sending to another channel in the guild.
examples:
await message.sendTo(logChannelId, 'User ' + message.author.username + ' said: ' + message.content);
await message.sendTo(announceChannelId, { embeds: [embed.toJSON()] });

methods.name: unpin
methods.description: Unpin this message from the channel. Requires Manage Messages permission.

properties.name: Flags
properties.type: { readonly SuppressEmbeds: number; readonly SuppressNotifications: number; readonly VoiceMessage: number; readonly CompactAttachments: number; }

Converts a Unix timestamp (ms) to a snowflake string.
Useful for pagination (before/after).

classes.name: VoiceConnection
classes.description: Voice connection using Discord's UDP-based protocol. Emits `ready`, `error`, `disconnect`.

methods.name: connect
methods.description: Called when we have both server update and state update.

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Disconnect and remove all listeners.

methods.name: disconnect
methods.description: Disconnect from voice (closes WebSocket and UDP).

methods.name: play
methods.description:
Play a direct WebM/Opus URL or stream. Fetches the URL (if string), demuxes with prism-media WebmDemuxer,
and sends Opus packets to the voice connection. No FFmpeg or encoding; input must be WebM with Opus.

methods.name: playOpus
methods.description:
Play a stream of raw Opus packets
Uses the same queue and 20ms pacing as play(). Use this for local files (MP3  PCM  Opus) or other Opus sources.

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stop playback and clear the queue.

classes.name: VoiceManager
classes.description: Manages voice connections. Use `getVoiceManager(client)` to obtain an instance.

properties.name: connectionIds
properties.description: guild_id -> connection_id (from VoiceServerUpdate; required for voice state updates when in channel)

properties.name: pending
properties.type: Map<string, { channel: VoiceChannel; resolve: (c: VoiceConnection | LiveKitRtcConnection) => void; reject: (e: Error) => void; server?: GatewayVoiceServerUpdateDispatchData | undefined; state?: GatewayVoiceStateUpdateDispatchData | undefined; }>

properties.name: voiceStates
properties.description: guild_id -> user_id -> channel_id

methods.name: getConnection

params.name: guildId
params.description: Guild ID to look up

methods.description: Get the active voice connection for a guild, if any.

methods.name: getVoiceChannelId

params.name: guildId
params.description: Guild ID to look up

params.name: userId
params.description: User ID to look up

methods.description: Get the voice channel ID the user is currently in, or null if not in voice.

params.name: data
params.type: { guildId: string; voiceStates: Array<{ user_id: string; channel_id: string | null; }>; }

methods.name: join

params.name: channel
params.description: The voice channel to join

methods.description: Join a voice channel. Resolves when the connection is ready.

methods.name: leave

params.name: guildId
params.description: Guild ID to leave

methods.description: Leave a guild's voice channel and disconnect.

methods.name: updateVoiceState

params.name: guildId
params.description: Guild ID

params.name: partial
params.type: { self_stream?: boolean; self_video?: boolean; self_mute?: boolean; self_deaf?: boolean; }
params.description: Partial voice state to update (self_stream, self_video, self_mute, self_deaf)

methods.description:
Update voice state (e.g. self_stream, self_video) while in a channel.
Sends a VoiceStateUpdate to the gateway so the server and clients see the change.
Requires connection_id (from VoiceServerUpdate); without it, the gateway would treat
the update as a new join and trigger a new VoiceServerUpdate, causing connection loops.

methods.name: uploadStreamPreview
methods.description: Upload a placeholder stream preview so the preview URL returns 200 instead of 404.

classes.name: Webhook
classes.description:
Represents a Discord/Fluxer webhook. Supports creating, fetching, sending, and deleting.
The token is only available when the webhook was created; fetched webhooks cannot send messages.

params.name: data
params.description: API webhook from POST /channels/{id}/webhooks (has token) or GET /webhooks/{id} (no token)

properties.name: token
properties.description: Present only when webhook was created via createWebhook(); not returned when fetching.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Delete this webhook. Requires bot token with Manage Webhooks permission.

methods.name: edit

params.name: options
params.description: Fields to update (name, avatar, channel_id when using bot auth)

methods.description: Edit this webhook. With token: name and avatar only. Without token (bot auth): name, avatar, and channel_id.

methods.name: fetch

params.name: client
params.description: The client instance

params.name: webhookId
params.description: The webhook ID

methods.description: Fetch a webhook by ID using bot auth.

methods.name: fromToken

params.name: client
params.description: The client instance

params.name: webhookId
params.description: The webhook ID

params.name: token
params.description: The webhook token (from createWebhook or stored)

params.name: options
params.type: { channelId?: string; guildId?: string; name?: string; }
params.description: Optional channelId, guildId, name for display

methods.description: Create a Webhook instance from an ID and token (e.g. from a stored webhook URL).

methods.name: send
methods.description: Send a message via this webhook. Requires the webhook token (only present when created, not when fetched).

properties.name: lastHeartbeatAck
properties.description: True until we send a heartbeat; then false until we get HeartbeatAck. Avoids closing before first heartbeat.

properties.name: reconnectDelayMs
properties.description: Current reconnect delay in ms; resets on successful connect.

interfaces.name: APIApplicationCommandInteraction
interfaces.description: Minimal application command interaction (slash command) payload from the gateway.

properties.name: data
properties.type: { id?: string; name: string; type?: number; options?: Array<{ name: string; type: number; value?: unknown; }>; }

interfaces.name: APIAttachmentPayload
interfaces.description: API format for an attachment in a message payload.

interfaces.name: APIChannel
interfaces.description: Channel from GET /channels/{id} or GET /guilds/{id}/channels

properties.name: url
properties.description: External URL (link channels, type 998)

interfaces.name: APIChannelOverwrite
interfaces.description: Permission overwrite from GET /channels/{id} or GET /guilds/{id}/channels

interfaces.name: APIChannelPartial
interfaces.description: Minimal channel (id, type required)

properties.name: children
properties.description: Nested embeds from unfurlers

interfaces.name: APIEmbedChild
interfaces.description: Nested embed from unfurlers (subset of APIEmbed)

properties.name: flags
properties.description: EmbedMediaFlags bitfield (e.g. CONTAINS_EXPLICIT_MEDIA)

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: Base64 placeholder for lazy loading

properties.name: errors
properties.type: { path: string; message: string; code?: string; }[]

interfaces.name: APIGatewayBotResponse
interfaces.description:
Response from GET /gateway/bot
url: WebSocket URL, session_start_limit: rate limit info in ms

properties.name: session_start_limit
properties.type: { total: number; remaining: number; reset_after: number; max_concurrency: number; }

interfaces.name: APIGuild
interfaces.description: Guild from GET /guilds/{id} or gateway GUILD_CREATE

interfaces.name: APIGuildAuditLog
interfaces.description: Response from GET /guilds/{id}/audit-logs

properties.name: users
properties.type: { id: Snowflake; username?: string; discriminator?: string; avatar?: string | null; }[]

properties.name: webhooks
properties.type: { id: Snowflake; name?: string; avatar?: string | null; }[]

interfaces.name: APIGuildAuditLogEntry
interfaces.description: Audit log entry from GET /guilds/{id}/audit-logs

properties.name: changes
properties.type: { key: string; old_value?: unknown; new_value?: unknown; }[]

interfaces.name: APIGuildMember
interfaces.description: Guild member from GET /guilds/{guild_id}/members or GET /guilds/{guild_id}/members/{user_id}

interfaces.name: APIMessage
interfaces.description: Message from GET /channels/{id}/messages, POST /channels/{id}/messages, PATCH, or gateway MESSAGE_CREATE

properties.name: call
properties.description: Call info when type is Call

properties.name: message_snapshots
properties.description: Snapshots of forwarded messages

properties.name: content_hash
properties.description: Hash of attachment content for integrity

properties.name: flags
properties.description: MessageAttachmentFlags bitfield

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: Base64 placeholder for lazy loading

properties.name: waveform
properties.description: Base64 audio waveform for voice messages

interfaces.name: APIMessageCall
interfaces.description: Call metadata for call-type messages

interfaces.name: APIMessageReference
interfaces.description: Reply/forward reference from GET /channels/{id}/messages (type 0 = reply)

properties.name: type
properties.description: 0 = reply, 1 = forward

interfaces.name: APIMessageSnapshot
interfaces.description: Snapshot of a forwarded message

interfaces.name: APIRole
interfaces.description:
Role from GET /guilds/{id}/roles
permissions is bitfield as string (e.g. "8933636165185")

interfaces.name: APIUserPartial
interfaces.description: Partial user object returned by the API (messages, members, webhooks, etc.).

properties.name: avatar_color
properties.description: RGB color as number (e.g. 7577782)

properties.name: bot
properties.description: Present when author is a bot

properties.name: flags
properties.description: Public/user flags bitfield

properties.name: system
properties.description: Whether this is an official system user

interfaces.name: APIWebhook
interfaces.description: Webhook from GET /channels/{id}/webhooks (includes token) or GET /webhooks/{id} (no token)

properties.name: token
properties.description: Present when listing channel webhooks; not returned when fetching by ID without token

interfaces.name: APIWebhookTokenUpdateRequest
interfaces.description: Request body for PATCH /webhooks/{id}/{token} (token auth). All fields optional.

interfaces.name: APIWebhookUpdateRequest
interfaces.description: Request body for PATCH /webhooks/{id} (bot auth). All fields optional.

interfaces.name: AttachmentData
interfaces.description: Attachment data for multipart requests.

interfaces.name: AttachmentPayloadOptions
interfaces.description:
Builder for message attachment metadata (filename, description, spoiler).
Actual file data is passed separately when sending (e.g. FormData).

interfaces.name: BitFieldResolvable
interfaces.description:
Data structure that allows efficient storage of multiple flags (bits) in a single number.

Note: JavaScript bitwise operations (|, &, ^, <<, >>) operate on 32-bit signed integers.
Flags with values exceeding 2^30 may exhibit unexpected behavior. For permission-style
bitfields with more than 30 bits, consider using BigInt-based implementations.

properties.name: [Events.VoiceStatesSync]
properties.type: [data: { guildId: string; voiceStates: Array<{ user_id: string; channel_id: string | null; }>; }]

properties.name: presence
properties.description: Initial presence (status, custom_status, etc.) sent on identify. Can also update via PresenceUpdate after connect.

properties.name: WebSocket
properties.type: new (url: string) => { send(data: string | ArrayBufferLike): void; close(code?: number): void; readyState: number; addEventListener?(type: string, listener: (e: unknown) => void): void; on?(event: string, cb: (data?: unknown) => void): void; }
properties.description: Optional WebSocket constructor (e.g. `require('ws')` in Node for compatibility)

interfaces.name: EmbedAuthorOptions
interfaces.description: Author field for an embed.

interfaces.name: EmbedFieldData
interfaces.description: A single embed field (name, value, optional inline).

interfaces.name: EmbedFooterOptions
interfaces.description: Footer field for an embed.

interfaces.name: GatewayCustomStatus
interfaces.description: Custom status object (Fluxer uses this root object rather than Discord-style activities array).

interfaces.name: GatewayHelloData
interfaces.description: // Incoming (gateway -> client)

interfaces.name: GatewayIdentifyData
interfaces.description: // Outgoing (client -> gateway)

properties.name: properties
properties.type: { os: string; browser: string; device: string; }

interfaces.name: GatewayInviteCreateDispatchData
interfaces.description: Invite payload for INVITE_CREATE (has full invite data).

interfaces.name: GatewayInviteDeleteDispatchData
interfaces.description: Invite payload for INVITE_DELETE (code + channel/guild only).

properties.name: activities
properties.type: { name: string; type: number; url?: string | null; }[]

properties.name: custom_status
properties.description: Custom status; set text (and optionally emoji) for bots. Passable on identify and via presence update.

interfaces.name: GatewayReactionEmoji
interfaces.description: Emoji data sent with reaction events (id is null for unicode emoji).

interfaces.name: GatewayVoiceServerUpdateDispatchData
interfaces.description: Incoming voice server update (gateway -> client).

properties.name: connection_id
properties.description: Connection ID for subsequent voice state updates (Fluxer).

properties.name: connection_id
properties.description: Connection ID from VoiceServerUpdate; required for updates when already in channel.

properties.name: self_stream
properties.description: Whether the user is screen sharing / streaming.

properties.name: self_video
properties.description: Whether the user has video enabled (e.g. camera).

interfaces.name: GatewayVoiceStateUpdateDispatchData
interfaces.description: Incoming voice state update (gateway -> client).

properties.name: connection_id
properties.description: Connection ID for voice session (Fluxer).

properties.name: self_stream
properties.description: Whether the user is screen sharing / streaming.

interfaces.name: LiveKitRtcConnectionEvents
interfaces.description: LiveKit-specific: emitted when server sends leave (token expiry, server policy, etc.). Emitted before disconnect.

interfaces.name: MessageEditOptions
interfaces.description: Options for editing a message (content and/or embeds).

properties.name: content
properties.description: New text content

properties.name: embeds
properties.description: New embeds (replaces existing)

interfaces.name: MessagePayloadData
interfaces.description: Data for a message payload (content, embeds, reply reference, etc.).

properties.name: attachments
properties.type: { id: number; filename: string; description?: string | null; }[]

properties.name: onReady
properties.type: (info: { tracks?: Array<{ id: number; type: string; codec: string; video?: { width: number; height: number; }; timescale?: number; }>; }) => void

properties.name: onSamples
properties.type: (trackId: number, user: unknown, samples: Array<{ data: ArrayBuffer; is_sync?: boolean; is_rap?: boolean; timescale: number; dts: number; duration: number; }>) => void

interfaces.name: PartialMessage
interfaces.description: Minimal message data for MessageDelete when the full message is not available.

interfaces.name: RateLimitState
interfaces.description:
Tracks rate limit state per bucket (route hash).
Delays requests when limit is exceeded.

interfaces.name: ReadonlyCollection
interfaces.description: Read-only view of a Collection (e.g. for method return types).

properties.name: files
properties.type: { name: string; data: Blob | ArrayBuffer | Uint8Array; filename?: string; }[]

interfaces.name: RESTOptions
interfaces.description: Options for the REST client.

interfaces.name: Snowflake
interfaces.description:
Snowflake ID type - 64-bit unsigned integer as string.
Fluxer uses Twitter Snowflakes with epoch 1420070400000 (first second of 2015).

interfaces.name: VideoPlayOptions
interfaces.description: Options for video playback via {@link LiveKitRtcConnection.playVideo}.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Output height for resolution override (FFmpeg path).

properties.name: loop
properties.description: Loop video to keep stream continuously live (default: true).

properties.name: maxFramerate
properties.description: Max framerate for encoding (default: 60).

properties.name: source
properties.description: Track source hint - camera or screenshare (default: camera).

properties.name: useFFmpeg
properties.description: Use FFmpeg for decoding (avoids node-webcodecs; requires ffmpeg in PATH).

properties.name: videoBitrate
properties.description: Max video bitrate in bps for encoding (default: 2_500_000).

properties.name: width
properties.description: Output width for resolution override (FFmpeg path).

interfaces.name: VoiceConnectionLike
interfaces.description: Union of connection types (Discord-style or LiveKit).

interfaces.name: VoiceManagerOptions
interfaces.description: Options for creating a VoiceManager.

properties.name: shardId
properties.description: Gateway shard ID to use for voice (default 0).

interfaces.name: VoiceStateMap
interfaces.description: Maps guild_id -> user_id -> channel_id (null if not in voice).

interfaces.name: WebhookSendOptions
interfaces.description: Options for sending a message via webhook.

properties.name: avatar_url
properties.description: Override the webhook's default avatar URL

properties.name: content
properties.description: Message text content

properties.name: embeds
properties.description: Embed objects (use EmbedBuilder.toJSON())

properties.name: tts
properties.description: Text-to-speech

properties.name: username
properties.description: Override the webhook's default username

properties.name: version
properties.description: Gateway API version (e.g. "1" for Fluxer). Defaults to "1" when not set.

enums.name: APIErrorCode
enums.description:
API error codes returned by the Fluxer API.
Subset of commonly used codes for bot development.

enums.name: ChannelType
enums.description:
Channel type enum (Fluxer/Discord compatible).
API may return additional types (e.g. 998 for link channels with url).
